info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 4:10PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...THunderstorms with Heavy Rainfall Impacting Lynchburg Metropolitan Area... ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall from slow moving thunderstorms is expected or is already occurring. * WHERE...In Central and South Central Virginia, southern Amherst County, eastern Bedford County, northern Campbell County, and the City of Lynchburg. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 404 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to persistent thunderstorms tracking along and near the U.S. 460 corridor between Bedford and Lynchburg. Broadcast media has already reported issues with overflowing poor drainage areas resulting in minor flooding in parts of Lynchburg City. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen have fallen in this region during the past hour. Additional rainfall up to an inch is possible over the next hour or so. - Lynchburg City and east Bedford county are the most likely areas to experience flooding. This includes the following streams and drainages... Blackwater Creek, Burton Creek, Elk Creek, Dreaming Creek, Big Otter River and Buffalo Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lynchburg... Bedford... Forest... Timberlake... Goode... Madison Heights... - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
